greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = tau(n) + tau(n+1), where tau(n) = A000005(n), the number of divisors of n.
comment: If a child is born to an n-year-old parent, this is the number of times the age of the parent will be a multiple of the age of the child. E.g., if n = 27, this will happen at the ages (28, 1), (29, 1),(30, 2), (30, 3), (32, 4), (35, 7), (42, 14), (36, 9), (54, 27), (56, 28). - _Alexander Piperski_, Sep 10 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Mar 22 2004
